result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie L Beahm

records.addlTxt:
10:04 AM Defendant Stephanie L Beahm appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Stephanie L Beahm.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CF111 & 22CF115 tracking together:
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaints in both matters & waives the reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties in both cases.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelims in both matters and asks for a status be set.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing in both matters.
bonds continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

11:12 AM Defendant Stephanie L Beahm appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions. 

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 

Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
